alert.note: Alert for Clinton (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 25 at 10:58AM EDT until March 30 at 2:00AM EDT by NWS Grand Rapids
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Michigan... Maple River at Maple Rapids affecting Clinton County. .The Maple River at Maple Rapids will continue to gradually rise through Saturday due to the recent rains that have fallen over the area. Additional rainfall/melted snowfall will be under a quarter of an inch, and should not have a big impact on the river. For the Maple River...including Maple Rapids...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Maple River at Maple Rapids. * WHEN...Until early Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Expect minor flooding of County Line Road and a home along County Line Road. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:15 AM EDT Friday the stage was 8.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this afternoon to a crest of 9.4 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Tuesday afternoon. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.4 feet on 03/05/1974. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/grr. The next statement will be issued on Saturday.
